comments:
1. In Java editor, choose to show source of selected element only
2. Navigate->Go to Line.. and enter a line that is not currently shown
3. Now the whole source of the file is shown again

I suspect Go to Line.. is not the only navigation action that causes show 
source.. to stop working.  It would be nice for the actions to apply to shown 
source, or maybe at least tell the user action could not be performed on 
current display.

Note: I opened this defect on Platform->Text even though it looks like the only 
way to see this defect is through the Java editor, but I have an editor that 
does something similar, and I believe the problem has to do with actions not 
really handling hidden/visible regions.

I am using I200404220800 also and I still see the problem.  I changed the 
summary title a little bit.  Show Source of Selected Element Only doesn't stop 
working in the sense that it throws errors, it just stops showing the source of 
selected element only, instead it shows the whole file.  If i deselect the Show 
Source.. option and then reselect, it works again.
Please provide exact steps. Couldn't reproduce either.

Here is a specific example:
1. Open AbstractTextEditor in Java Editor
2. Place cursor in initializeSourceViewer method
3. Click on Show Source of Selected Element Only toolbar menu item
4. Only source for initializeSourceViewer method is displayed
5. Ctrl+L (Navigate->Go to Line..)
6. Enter "1"
7. All source is now shown (cursor jumps to line 1)
     Show Source of Selected Element Only toolbar menu item is still enabled


Sometimes, I also seem to run into problems when I start selecting some methods 
in the Outline view after I run the above steps.

comment 4 shows two things:

1) assertion failure which is a JIT bug in your JRE (see bug 55814 for details,
it also contains a workaround)

2) the fact that it does not narrow down to the enclosing element when the
selection changes. This is as designed: we only show the element if you select
the Java element in a view or a quick outline and not due to changed text selection.

Ok, the comments I made after the 7 steps in comment 4 can be ignored for now 
because that was just something additional that I had noticed as i was 
recreating my steps.  

The main point of this bug was to address that when you are only viewing a 
small portion of code, Go to Line.. allows you to navigate to "hidden" regions 
of the code.  And once you navigate to a nonvisible region, the entire source 
is shown again.

One possible solution could be that when you are in a projection document/there 
is a visible region, Go to Line.. should only allow you to enter a line number 
that is currently visible.  Or, if you enter a line number that is not visible, 
give some sort of warning/error.

My real reason/scenario for wanting this defect fixed is that the editor I am 
working on almost always sets a visible region, so it's like I always only show 
source of selected element.  I do not want users to be able to navigate to the 
hidden portion of the code or somehow trigger my editor to show all source.  
And currently, Go to Line.. will do this.

If you write your own editor you can also write your own GotoLineAction
(ITextEditorActionDefinitionIds.LINE_GOTO).
